strings: <voice_0x010012EF><se_low>Marta: Please, drink. This nook grass tea will keep you warm even in the bitter cold of this snowy land.
<voice_0x010012F0><se_low>King Trode: How terribly kind of you. First you save us from the avalanche, then you put us up for the night, and now you warm our innards!
<voice_0x010012F1><se_low>King Trode: Now that's what I call hospitality!
<voice_0x010012F2><se_low>Yangus: An' what's really amazin' is that you 'elped a weird old monster like 'im in the first place!
<voice_0x010012F3><se_low>King Trode: You loathsome lowlife! You of all people have no right to call me ‘weird’!
<voice_0x010012F4><se_low>Marta: It is true that his appearance is a little unusual. But when you get to my age, you learn not to judge a horse by its harness.
<voice_0x010012F5><se_low>Marta: And of course I would help anyone who was in trouble so far from civilisation.
<voice_0x010012F6><se_high>Jessica: I hope you don't mind me asking, but why do you live all the way out here on your own?

<voice_0x010012F7><se_low>Marta: Of course I do not mind, dear! There is an
old ruin behind my house. My ancestors have
looked after it generation after generation.
It is a family duty.
<voice_0x010012F8><se_low>Marta: But that will all end with me. I have no one to follow in my footsteps when my life is finished.
<voice_0x010012F9><se_high>Jessica: Really? It must be pretty tough living on your own like this, duty or no duty.

<voice_0x010012FA><se_low>Marta: It is comfortable enough. I have lived here since I was a child, so it is not a hardship. Besides,
to live life is not to walk through a meadow.

<voice_0x010012FB><se_low>Marta: And from time to time people get lost here in the mountains like you, so I am not lonely.
And I always have Boris to keep me company.
<voice_0x010012FC><se_def>Angelo: Ah, on the subject of dogs, we had something to ask you, Marta.
<voice_0x010012FD><se_def>Angelo: This will sound a bit strange but we're pursuing a big black dog, and we heard that he might have been headed in this direction.
<voice_0x010012FE><se_def>Angelo: There's a good chance he may have come this way. Have you seen anything?
<voice_0x010012FF><se_low>Marta: Hm... No, I am sorry. The only dog I know about is big old Boris over there.

<voice_0x01001300><se_low>Marta: Sorry I cannot be of more help.
You should ask where there is a lot of people.
<voice_0x01001301><se_low>Marta: If you go down the mountain and go to the north, you will come to a town called Orkutsk. Maybe someone will know something there.

<voice_0x01001302><se_low>King Trode: Ah, that sounds like an excellent idea.
Right then, chaps! There's no time to lose!
<voice_0x01001303><se_low>Marta: Oh-yo-yoy! If you are hasty, others will only be amused. That is an old saying here. One should not be so eager to go back out into the blizzard.

<voice_0x01001304><se_low>Marta: The night is coming.
Why don't you rest here?
<voice_0x01001305><se_low>Marta: I am sure the blizzard will be gone by morning, so you can leave for Orkutsk then.
<voice_0x01001306><se_low>King Trode: Yes, yes, wise words, my good woman. Very well! We shall rest here for the night.
